title: 'Straight women are gay for the stay': Amanda Knox opens up about lesbian relationship in prison
text:
Amanda Knox after being definitively acquitted of murder in 2015 (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Amanda Knox has opened up about her lesbian relationship with an inmate while locked up in an Italian prison. 
Knox was 22 when she was jailed for the murder of British student Meredith Kercher who was brutally stabbed to death at the apartment they shared in Perugia. 
The verdict was later quashed and Knox returned to the US in 2011. 
She now writes columns and advocates for the wrongly convicted. The prison in Perugia where Knox was locked up (Photo: Wikipedia Commons) 
To mark Valentine's Day, Knox, now aged 29, wrote about her experience of romance in prison for Broadly. 
She says she had a brief fling with a female inmate she called "Leny". 
"I noticed her immediately: petite, with a paunchy belly and short, dark hair," Knox wrote. 
Knox said Leny soon told her she was a lesbian and was delighted when Knox said she had supported LGBT campaigns in school. 
"Afterwards, she scampered, puppy-like, alongside me as I paced the exercise yard—the next day, and the day after that, and eventually every day." Knox said the woman "scampered, puppy-like, alongside me as I paced the yard" (Photo: Reuters) 
"So I let Leny listen to my CDs. 
"I taught her how to play chess. 
"When Leny got a janitorial job, she loitered outside my cell for a sip of espresso and a chat whenever she was on break." 
Knox said romance between women in prison was common, even if the majority in relationships would have identified as heterosexual. 
They would say they were "Gay for the stay", according to Knox. Knox said heterosexual women in prison would say they were "gay for the stay" (Photo: PA) 
On her relationship, Knox wrote: "At least initially, Leny might not have been trying to seduce me, and was actually just in need of someone kind to distract her from her loneliness. 
"'I've changed women before,' she'd tell me. 'I can do things to you that no man can.' 
"I felt objectified and I'd get annoyed. 'You can't change me,' I'd respond." 
Leny eventually kissed Knox and she said she felt "embarrassment and anger". 
"I told Leny that since she couldn't respect my boundaries, we couldn't be friends anymore," she concluded. Meredith Kercher (Photo: PA) Rudy Guede remains in prison (Photo: Getty) 
Meredith Kercher, who was 21, was sexually assaulted, had her throat slashed and was stabbed 47 times in 2007. 
Knox and then-boyfriend Raffaele Sollecito were convicted of her murder along with drifter Rudy Guede . 
The former couple were found guilty in 2009 but freed on appeal two years later. 
Their guilty verdict was reinstated in 2014 but quashed by Italy’s top court in March 2015. 
Guede remains in prison for the murder. 
Last month an Italian court refused to review his conviction. Like us on Facebook
